verses.name: Proverbs 2:1
verses.text: My son, if thou wilt receive my words, and hide my commandments with thee;

verses.name: Proverbs 2:2
verses.text: So that thou incline thine ear unto wisdom, and apply thine heart to understanding;

verses.name: Proverbs 2:3
verses.text: Yea, if thou criest after knowledge, and liftest up thy voice for understanding;

verses.name: Proverbs 2:4
verses.text: If thou seekest her as silver, and searchest for her as for hid treasures;

verses.name: Proverbs 2:5
verses.text: Then shalt thou understand the fear of the Lord, and find the knowledge of God.

verses.name: Proverbs 2:6
verses.text: For the Lord giveth wisdom: out of his mouth cometh knowledge and understanding.

verses.name: Proverbs 2:7
verses.text: He layeth up sound wisdom for the righteous: he is a buckler to them that walk uprightly.
